content: times 3sc 1dc 1sc 15dc 3sc 2dc 4sc 1dc 1dc row 27 in colour a *1dc 3sc repeat from * 3 times 1sc row 12 in colour b 1sc 3dc *1sc 1dc repeat from * 3 9dc 8sc 10dc 1dc times 3dc 1sc 1dc 14sc 1rdc 3dc 1ldc 1sc 3rdc 2sc 1sc row 28 in colour b *1sc 3dc repeat from * 2 times 16sc row 13 in colour a 1dc 3sc *1dc 1sc repeat from * 3 1ldc 3dc 12sc 1sc times 3sc 1dc 1sc 11dc 12sc 2dc 1dc row 29 in colour a *1dc 3sc repeat from * 2 times 16dc row 14 in colour b 1sc 3dc *1sc 1dc repeat from * 3 4sc 12dc 1dc times 3dc 1sc 1dc 10sc 10rdc 5sc 1sc row 30 in colour b 1sc 3dc 21sc 1rdc 14sc 1sc row 31 in colour a 1dc 3sc 21dc 1sc 14dc 1dc i zzy and frog horse bookend motif page 8/10 chart 4 - horse facing right left handed key single_crochet blo single_crochet in back loop only worked into stitch of the opposite colour in row below x x double_crochet flo double_crochet in front loop only worked into stitch of the same colour two row below right-angled double_crochet in front loop only \ \ rdc flo worked into stitch of the same colour to the right two row below left-angled double_crochet in front loop only / / ldc flo worked into stitch of the same colour to the left two row below double_crochet 2 together in front loop only double_crochet-rdc-2tog x\ the left side is a double_crochet worked into the stitch of the same colour two row below flo the right side is a rdc worked into the stitch of the same colour to the right two row below 0 chain chain row 0 is only necessary if this chart makes up part of your bottom shelf notes - column 41 should only be worked if this chart is the last rightmost chart on your shelf - the unnumbered columns marked a and b are a guide to show which colour should be used for that row and should not be worked - stitches in the opposite colour to the row will be always be single_crochet blo for this reason it is not necessary to pay attention to the colour of a given stitch when reading the chart only the symbol matters - sometimes more than one stitch will be worked into the same front loop such as when a ldc follows a double_crochet or a double_crochet follows a rdc some front loops will be skipped entirely such as when a rdc follows a double_crochet izzy and frog horse bookend motif page 9/10 written pattern for chart 4 horse facing right left handed notes - column 41 should only be worked if this is the last rightmost pattern on your shelf instructions for column 41 will be included in square brackets and italics - all single_crochet should be in back loop only -
